intro: Hieracium hispidosum, commonly known as the hispid hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often glandular. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium hispidosum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
